page.title: 03BENTCLIFF HILL LANE AREA.
page.content: Bentcliff Hill Lane (F.P.) is known locally as Gipsy Lane.It widens out further on, this would have been the site of the Gipsy camp.The{Opencast {Working}has been extended over the years.The workers found clay and placed a small works to make pipes for drainage.Naylors of Denby Dale took over the site which in turn was taken over by Hepworth Iron Company. The North-west side of South Lane up to Naylors Pipe Works is open-cast working for clay. The ground is landscaped after.One field was drained with pipes because a pond used to form at the fence.The field was landscaped after and you wouldn't be able to tell the difference today. The belonged to the farmer who Daniel Cooper used to live next to, at Hill House Farm.
